inference: The equation $f(x) = c$ has exactly $6$ solutions if and only if the horizontal line $y = c$ intersects the graph of $y = f(x)$ in exactly six points.  We see that this occurs for the lines $y = -4$, $y = -3$, and $y = -2$.  The sum of these integers is $(-4) + (-3) + (-2) = \boxed{-9}$.
